Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Muslims are spreading COVID-19 by smearing saliva on plates and utensils.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video showing Muslims licking plates and utensils is related to the spread of COVID-19, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video was filmed in 2018, almost a year before the COVID-19 outbreak, as confirmed by a member of the Bohra Committee.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by falsely implicating Muslims in the spread of COVID-19 based on a misleading video.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video was filmed to educate community members against wastage of food, rather than being related to the spread of COVID-19.
